titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John Shackelford, Indictment
CWG6882

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Madison Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against
James M Shackelford

The Grand jury of Madison County in the name and by the at authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse James M Schackelford of the -- committed of as follows, Viz: the Said James M Schackelford on the 30th day of June 1865 in the County aforesaid Willfully and Maliciously shot at and wounded Squire Turner with a gun loaded with leaden balls and of other hard substances with the intent to Kill him but from which shooting and wounding the said Turner did not die, against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Witnesses:
Squire Turner
Thos J Gordon
William Cusick

A copy att J M Shackelford clk
By Robert E Little D C

Madison Cir Ct
Commonwealth of Ky
vs } Shooting Intent to Kill A copy
James M Schackelford
Offense
Pardoned
(Copy)
10 Aug/65
